snippet: The announcement from a deputy prime minister raised speculation about who would attend and who would represent the fractured opposition.
abstract: Syrian Deputy Prime Min Qadri Jamil says long-postponed international peace talks known as Geneva II could be held in late November; comment raises speculation about who will attend and  represent the fractured Syrian opposition, which is seeking to topple Pres Bashar al-Assad.

byline.contributor: Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The announcement from a deputy prime minister raised speculation about who would attend and who would represent the fractured opposition.

headline.main: Syrian Official Says Peace Talks Could Be Held in Late November
headline.print_headline: Syrian Official Says Peace Talks Could Be Held in Late November

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
